addressleaf.section:
To
e right Worshipp
ll
my very lovinge friende M
r
Thomas Bodleigh Esq
r
, her M
ty
Counse
ll
ar in
e Counsail of state of
e united provinces in
e Low Contreies. at
e Hage or else where./

From S
r
Frauncis Walsingham dated the vj
th
of Julye 1589

page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 Novem
b
To M
r
Bodly.
M
r
Bodleigh
S
r
, Wheras ther were by consente of the
States
uppon motion
therof made unto them by
S
r
John Norreis
in her
Ma
ties
name six hundred
horse drawen out of those Companies serving
at
in those Countries uppon
her Ma
ties
Cha
r
g for the service of
Portugall,
forasmuch as the said
Companies are in the same voyadge much Weakned and lessned and that ther is not convenient meanes at this p[nte to make them up againe considering the small [some] of horse there is here w
th
in the Relm, and the
occasions that ar likelie to be of use of such as we have, ther
Ma
tie
hathe therfore resolved to have the states moeved for the Cha
r
g of
the said Companies of horse into footemen, allowing for ev
r
y hundred horse
two hundred footemen, w
ch
her pleasure is yo
w
should doe and that w
th
all
convenient expedition to the end that uppon the resoluc
o
n ther taken and
retourned hith
r
she maie give order accordinglye. To this effect I
have willed in her Ma
ties
name to the Deputies Here to sollicite the
same to the States w
ch
I doubt not but theie have done. For the
rest such newes as we have here I send yo
w
herewithe
and so doe co
m
it
yo
w
to god. From the Court at Nonesuche the of Julye 1589.
Yo
r
Loving frend Francis Walsyngham
There is alreadye order taken for
the sending over of 1200 men
of thos that
[.]
are returned owt of
Hortogen
for the supplye of the seyd 6 bands
of horsemen: and therfore you may
urge them to allowe of this re-
solutyon: for that yt wyll be but
in vayne for them to urge the contract.
